definitions: To cut the wool off (a sheep or other animal).
To cut off (hair or wool) with shears or a similar instrument.
To break off or cause to break off due to a shearing force.
To remove by cutting or clipping.
examples: The farmer will shear the sheep next week.
The metal bar sheared under the immense pressure.
She used to shear her own hair.
The machine can shear through thick steel.
